plugin._field_explanation: If the damage is below the lower bound, the surface won't break. If the damage is above the upper bound, the surface always breaks. In the middle, the surface will break with a weighted random chance. Negative values mean that the surface will never break from that kind of damage.

_field_real_bounds.name: direct damage vitality#this is damage from bullets hitting the surface

collision damage impulse thresholds#not really vitality - this is mass * velocity into the surface. Running player bipeds cap out around 255 run 'event_display_category physics:breakable_surfaces verbose' to get verbose information about damage to breakable surfaces
AoE damage vitality!#not actually in use yet...

_field_short_integer.name: sort bias#use values between -10 and 10 to move closer and farther from camera (positive is closer)

item.Name: particles continue as usual when offscreen{skip visibility test}{cinematics}
particles die when effect ends{die when orphaned}
use synchronized random seed#synchronized across particle systems
use world orientation#particle system uses local-space position but up is always 'global up'
render in spawn order#first particle spawned renders first (at the back), last particle spawned renders last (front)
dynamic particle resolution#use distance and multiplier (below) to tune high- or low-res rendering

_field_real_bounds.name: percent velocity to inherit#flag must be checked above

_field_real.name: size scale#multiplied by all "size" related fields, like scale, velocity, acceleration
camera offset:world units#the particle is pushed away from the camera this distance (can be negative)
near fade range:world units#distance beyond cutoff over which particles fade
near fade cutoff:world units#distance in front of camera where fade is complete*
near fade override:world units#distance in front of camera where fade is complete
far fade range:world units#distance before cutoff over which particles fade
far fade cutoff:world units#distance from camera where fade is complete
LOD feather out delta#0 defaults to 5.0, minimum is 0.0001

item.Name: volume emitter particle velocities are random#By default, particles emit radially away from the emitter center. This option gives them random velocity instead. This only applies to volume emitters.

_field_real.name: bounding radius estimate*:world units#used if override is zero
bounding radius override:world units#used if non-zero

_field_real_point_3d.name: axis scale#NOTE - setting this will break automatic bounding sphere calculation, you must enter radius manually

_field_struct.name: translational offset:world units#XYZ controls that offset the emitter's origin from the original location

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: relative direction#yaw/pitch that changes the initial rotation of the emitter

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: emission radius:world units#defines the size of the emitter

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: emission angle:degrees#determines the angle at which particles are emitted

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: emission axis angle:degrees#determines the max tilt for particle axis

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle starting count#number of particles that are spawned at the birth of the effect

item.Name: particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}
particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle max count:0=unlimited#max number of particles allowed to exist at one time

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle emission rate:particles per second#number of particles that are spawned every second from the emitters

particle emission time{emitter time}{particle emit time}

_field_struct.name: particle emission per distance:particles per world unit#number of particles that are spawned every world unit of motion from the emitters

_field_struct.name: particle lifespan:seconds#the number of seconds a particle will live after emission

_field_real.name: force strength#positive pushes out, negative pulls in
sphere falloff begin:wus#doesn't work on cylinders, due to shader constant constraints
sphere falloff end:wus#doesn't work on cylinders, due to shader constant constraints

_field_struct.name: particle self-acceleration:world units per second per second
